Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of VOC Profiling in E. coli Strains

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at the Anesthesiology and Intensive Care Unit of the 10th Military Research Hospital and Polyclinic in Bydgoszcz, Poland.

Participants.evidence: Participants included reference strains and 21 clinical isolates of Escherichia coli from VAP patients.

Intervention.evidence: VOCs were analyzed using gas chromatography–mass spectrometry (GC-MS) at seven time points over 24 hours.

Objective.evidence: This study explores volatile organic compounds (VOCs) as biomarkers for pathogen identification and treatment monitoring.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the identification of VOC emission patterns.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A total of 57 VOCs were identified from the susceptible strain and 41 from the resistant strain.
